utilMDE
Class Lookup

java.lang.Object
  utilMDE.Lookup

public class Lookup
extends java.lang.Object

Lookup searches a set of files for information. The user specifies a set of keywords (or regular expressions), and Lookup outputs each entry that matches the keywords. In the simplest case, Lookup prints each paragraph (in any of the files) that contains all the keywords.

A file can contain one or more entries. A short entry is a single paragraph (delimited from the next entry by a blank line). A long entry is introduced by a line that begins with '>entry'. The remainder of that line is a one line description of the entry. A long entry is terminated by '<entry', by the start of a new long entry, or by the start of a new file.

Lookup searches for the keywords in the body of short entries and in the one-line description of long entries. An entry matches if it contains all of the keywords. If multiple entries match, the first line of each is printed. If only one entry matches, then that entry is printed in its entirety.

By default, Lookup searches the file ~/lookup/root. Files can contain comments and can include other files. Comments start with a % sign in the first column. Any comment line is ignored (it is not treated as a blank line for the purpose of separating entries). A file can include another file via a line of the form '\include{filename}'.

Field Detail

help

public static boolean help
Show detailed help information and exit.

entry_file

public static java.lang.String entry_file
Specify the search list for the file that contains information to be searched. Only the first file found is used. Files are separated by colons (:).

search_body

public static boolean search_body
Search the body of long entries in addition to the entry's description. The bodies of short entries are always searched.

regular_expressions

public static boolean regular_expressions
Specifies that keywords are regular expressions. If false, keywords are text matches.

case_sensitive

public static boolean case_sensitive
If true, keywords matching is case sensistive. By default both regular expressions and text keywords are case insensitive.

word_match

public static boolean word_match
If true, match a text keyword only as a separate word, not as a substring of a word. This option is ignored if regular_expressions is true.

print_all

public static boolean print_all
By default, if multiple entries are matched, only a synopsis of each entry is printed. If 'print_all' is selected then the body of each matching entry is printed.

item_num

public static java.lang.Integer item_num
Specifies which item to print when there are multiple matches.

show_location

public static boolean show_location
If true, show the filename/line number of each matching entry in the output.

verbose

public static boolean verbose

entry_start_re

public static java.util.regex.Pattern entry_start_re

entry_stop_re

public static java.util.regex.Pattern entry_stop_re

public static java.util.regex.Pattern description_re
